Construct a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Draw a circle with the following properties: * Center: [0.15, 0.15] * Radius: 0.15 Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.3. Construct a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Draw a circle with the following properties: * Center: [0.15, 0.15] * Radius: 0.15 Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.3. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using a rotation of 0.0 degrees around the X, Y, and Z axes and a translation vector of [0.6, 0.15, 0.15]. Extrude the 2D sketch to a depth of 0.15 units in the positive normal direction. **Part 4: Lid for the Prism** Create a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.15, 0.15, 0.6]. Construct a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Draw a rectangle with the following lines: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.3, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.3, 0.0], End Point [0.3, 0.3] * Line 3: Start Point [0.3, 0.3], End Point [0.0, 0.3] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.3], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.3. Extrude the 2D sketch to a depth of 0.15 units in the positive normal direction. With these instructions, you will create a CAD model of a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole and a plug in the center.</description>
